Description: Rim sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; exterior: maeander pattern running left; below, painted decoration consisting of horn and back of goat grazing to left; pendant triangle and dotted rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as 1888,0601.473.m, 1888,0601.478.l and 1888,0601.478.m, and 1924.12-1.309.b. Lemos describes the other sherds from this vessel as being in the style of the Würzburg chalices, but dated later than those chalices because she considers the style of the drawing to be debased and because of the elementary and isolated interior decoration (Lemos 1991, 72-3).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 252, no. 393)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0137) (phase 2)
